column4: in gnome, is there an equivalent to the windows "hide all windows and show me the desktop" shortcut?
it should be in the lower left corner
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RootSudo
try apt-cache search thinkpad.  There may be some packages
Only a few packages showed up with thinkpad as a keyword.
okay, just a suggestion
Cool.  I don't really mind "did you check to see if it's plugged in" type suggestions, I've made mistakes like that in the past :-).
interfaces are configured in /etc/network/interfaces
configure it in /etc/network/interfaces
nothing in /etc/network/interfaces mentions eth1.
man interfaces for some good documentation.  I'll give you a quick example too.
auto eth1
you sure you want to do lossy-to-lossy format conversion?
Well, I can re-rip some of them, but others I loaned the CD to a friend.
or, apt-cache policy bluez
that's not a -dev library
Come again?
you don't have a development library with headers installed.  You only have the shared libs installed.
i.e., get the -dev version of the library package
Ah-hah... now I see it.
will libbluetooth-dev and libbluetooth2-dev confict?
they may.  You'd have to investigate
